This game is NOT an RPG despite steam tags, it is visual novel/adventure and as a visual novel it is really one of the best in this genre. But I like RPG games and don't really like visual novel genre so should i recommend it? I will, yes, because the writing is really good, stories, music and climat are good and enjoyable but gameplay which is usually the most important thing for me isn't really convincing, it is too basic, there are no real rpg elements, adventure yes, you will immerse some good written stories and you have some decision which will change what outcome, mostly cards you get but thats it. Also minus from technical side, videos are not working for me, I must skip them (my graphic card rtx 2060). Overall game is not terrible, it is good in its department and unique, can be fun, you can enjoy it, so I recommend. PS - I got more interested in this game because of tv series Carnivale (same times and location) which i really liked ;-)
Very good story and soundtrack. A few different endings. Enjoyed the game.
A new better version of the best fantasy strategy game, continuously updated and extended. You will like it single player too. Mass of content.

It is a good game, an original concept (like in many Arcen companygames) and this is always very welcomed by me after playing numerous other similiar genre/climat games. You need to plan your strategy, in main game mode diplomacy is a key as you must help all (independent) space races to unite in alliance, all races are really much different so it is interesting goal, you are like a third side here and this is also unique. Events are there both random and planned by other races and you, everything is designed with some deep. Game looks very good, it has definitely very good music (really not expected this), everything is running very smooth. Often you need to take part in many quite similiar fight (like when fighting insurgents) which could be a "con" but they are very quick, enough so it is not bad. I can recommend. ps - Next time i will try on higher difficulties, espec. space fights seemed too easy to manage on my "normal" first playthrough.
The best game tagged as "casual" I ever played :)

Interesting multiplayer game, good gameplay but still many changes in early access, hard to tell how the game will finish.+ Different gameplay for both main classes and for sub-classes both of hunters and scavangers. Fun shooting and hunting experience for Hunter and co-operation, stealth playing of Scavangers, many different perks and powers making game more complex.- It still is much visible it is early access, dev are doing very big gameplay, mechanics and balance changes in patches like those last one and there are no info ingame about changes, after patches custom controls need to be set again and there are no infos about all actions possible with those keys in game especially for those newly created/changed mechanics, of course it can be all explained by early access.- No bots, if final product will not have them longivity of the game may be much shortened, also options of mixing players/bots could be good for a faster match starts/queues. In general i feel fps multiplayer games need to have bots for game to not risk dying too early.
Great climate and gameplay, mechanics even improved since Dishonored 1. Good locations, big fun to play.

+ Great depth of gameplay+ Another part of fantastic and the best football manager series+ For all fans of football and for all fans of tactics+ Good as always database+ Developing young players even better then before (09)+ Great simulation and strategy+- Extremely time consuming, good dedicated managers should get paid in real money for playing this lol :x- Some bugs from earlier versions still not fixed, like those with players registration to Club World Champ.- Some qualifing rules to club international cups are not described enought ingame like those in Mexican league. Well i could find many minor bugs but they are maybe not so important for overall review.

Eng: One of the best games ever, massive content and lore, planning and diversity, immersive climat, beside battle formations turn based queued orders planned before, very detailed amazing very deep fantasy strategy.ps - don't suggest my game hours, I played it without steam overlay. Edit: Updated with even more added content (free ofc) and factions and many other things as every version for very long time, now new version is coming (5) but it doesn't change much, it is a perfect game. Pl: Jedna z najlepszych gier w historii, rewelacyjna gra strategiczna, gleboka, ogromna zawartosc z rownie ogromnym lore.

Cependant, si vous vous lancez dans l'aventure principalement pour le c√¥t√© joueur contre joueur du titre, une seconde d√©ception vous attend.D'une part, nous avons le PvP sauvage. Vous pouvez activer/d√©sactiver le mode PvP lorsque vous √™tes en ville, pour ensuite partir √† la chasse aux joueurs. Vous r√©aliserez alors que la seule fa√ßon de "profiter" du PvP sauvage, c'est de vous aussi rejoindre un √©norme groupe pour rouler sur les malheureux quoi croiseront votre route.C'est aussi la seule fa√ßon pour une faction de d√©clarer la guerre √† un territoire : faire un bus, prendre les qu√™tes PvP, suivre le m√™me chemin boucle apr√®s boucle pendant une heure afin de remplir la jauge d'attaque, jusqu'√† pouvoir d√©clarer la guerre. M√™me si les factions adverses feront de m√™me pour vous contrer, la faction dominante sur le territoire ne pourra pas vraiment d√©fendre, tant leur influence sur la barre d'attaque sera r√©duite.Arrive alors la guerre : un joyeux bordel √† 50 contre 50. Malheureusement, les serveurs ne tiennent pas la route, et le lag vous emp√™chera de combattre convenablement. Proposer de si grandes batailles sans pouvoir assurer que √ßa fonctionne bien, c'est quand m√™me con. De plus, ces derni√®res sont √©litistes : la guilde qui poss√®de le territoire choisira ses combattants. En clair, si vous n'√™tes pas au niveau maximum, ou si quelqu'un ne vous aime pas, vous ne combattrez jamais.De plus, le jeu se voulant facilement abordable comme je l'expliquais plus haut, cela fait que le PvP n'est pas profond, et m√™me plut√¥t limit√©.Il reste heureusement la d√©ferlante, qui est un mode de jeu domination en 20 contre 20, sans distinction de faction, et qui se r√©v√®le plut√¥t sympathique.L'aspect PvE est lui plus r√©ussi. Atteindre le niveau maximum (qui est 60) se fait facilement car chaque action donne de l'exp√©rience, et obtenir un √©quipement haut niveau n'est pas bien dur. Vous tournerez donc vite en rond, car ce ne sont pas les quelques donjons que le jeu propose qui vous permettront une certaine rejouabilit√©, ni les diff√©rentes qu√™tes du jeu.Il reste les invasions, qui sont l'√©quivalent des guerres mais en PvE. Cette fois, la s√©lection des joueurs se fera diff√©remment. La guilde qui contr√¥le le territoire attaqu√© ne pourra choisir que 10 joueurs, les 40 autres seront d√©termin√©s al√©atoirement. Si cela permettait aux gens de pouvoir avoir une chance de participer √† du contenu haut niveau, ce n'est en fait pas si s√ªr, car durant les quinze minutes de pr√©paration pr√©c√©dant l'invasion, la guilde qui contr√¥le pourra exclure des joueurs, en esp√©rant qu'un autre plus "int√©ressant" soit s√©lectionn√©. En gros, ils peuvent faire en sorte de faire passer les copains.Le fait que des territoires puissent √™tre contr√¥l√©s directement par les joueurs offre une m√©canique int√©ressante au jeu, la gestion de l'√©conomie. Lorsque vous mettez des objets en vente √† l'h√¥tel des ventes, que vous fabriquerez des objets ou si vous poss√©dez une maison, diverses taxes appliqu√©es par la guilde qui contr√¥le la zone s'appliqueront. L'argent r√©col√© par les taxes servira ensuite √† am√©liorer la ville pour permettre aux joueurs d'avoir acc√®s √† des objets de plus haut niveau pour leur m√©tier, mais aussi pour la d√©fense de la ville lors des guerres et des invasions. Il est dommage que ce point puisse √™tre ruin√© par la communaut√©, j'y viendrais ensuite.Qui dit MMO, dit farming. Comme New World permet √† ses joueurs d'utiliser l'int√©gralit√© de tous les m√©tiers que le jeu propose, vous vous doutez que vous allez passer pas mal de temps √† cueillir, couper du bois, fabriquer des armes et j'en passe. Force est d'admettre que le farm dans New World est bien amen√©. Les ressources relient les m√©tiers entre eux, rendant la chose plus sympathique √† d√©couvrir et √† faire.Maintenant je vais aborder les deux points les plus n√©gatifs du jeu. Premi√®rement, les bugs. Il y en a √©norm√©ment, et ces derniers ont un impact fort et n√©gatif sur des aspects importants du titre comme le PvP ou l'√©conomie. Par exemple, √† l'heure o√π j'√©cris ces lignes il existe un bug qui permet √† la faction attaquante de gagner une guerre en seulement quelques minutes. Un autre a fait que les joueurs pouvaient dupliquer des objets et de l'argent, obligeant l'√©quipe de d√©veloppement √† bloquer l'h√¥tel des ventes et les √©changes. Des bugs concernant aussi les armes, rendant certaines totalement inefficaces en combat, alors que d'autres sont devenues extr√™mement mortelles.Deuxi√®mement, sa communaut√©. C'est lorsque l'on joue √† New World que l'on se dit qu'un MMO qui demande un abonnement mensuel, ce n'est pas forc√©ment une mauvaise chose. Cela permet de faire un tri, et d'√©viter d'avoir une communaut√© enti√®rement toxique.Car malheureusement, celle de New World est un cancer en phase terminale. Les canaux de discussions sont infest√©s de trolls, les insultes y fusent sans arr√™t, tout comme le trashtalk et les d√©bats idiots montrant toute absence intellectuelle chez certains. Si vous vous lancez dans le jeu, un conseil : masquez le tchat.Mais les choses ne s'arr√™tent malheureusement pas aux seules discussions. Comme New World propose un gameplay qui donne du pouvoir aux joueurs, vous allez avoir √† faire aux pires comportements possibles en jeu. Vous vous doutez que l'exploitation des bugs se fait √† outrance, les guildes qui ont du pouvoir n'h√©sitent parfois pas √† en abuser, celles qui n'ont pas de pouvoir n'h√©sitent parfois pas √† saboter la d√©fense des autres (alors qu'elles combattent pour la m√™me faction.). Il est aussi courant que le chef d'une guilde qui poss√®de un ou plusieurs territoires vole l'argent g√©n√©r√© par les taxes avant de fuir en d√©truisant la guilde, laissant un ou des territoires sans contr√¥le, cela ayant un impact n√©gatif sur l'influence de la faction et l'√©conomie.Bon, terminons au moins sur une note positive : l'OST du jeu est superbe. Malgr√© tout, je recommande ce jeu, car il reste possible de s'amuser entre amis, et si vous ne jouez pas avec de grosses attentes.Retrouvez mes critiques sur SensCritique ![www.senscritique.com]

Retrouvez toutes mes critiques sur SensCritique ![www.senscritique.com]Si vous jouez √† Deadlight uniquement pour sa trame sc√©naristique, vous faites erreur. Non pas parce qu'elle est mauvaise. M√™me si elle est agr√©able √† suivre, en grande partie gr√¢ce √† la belle direction artistique du jeu, elle reste pr√©visible et peu originale.Si un jeu comme Limbo a pu vous plaire, Deadlight devrait vous int√©resser. Des actions que vous r√©p√©tez pourtant sans arr√™t... Jusqu'au moment o√π le jeu vous dira merde, non, cette fois √ßa marchera pas, prend √ßa dans ta gueule. C'est un peu frustrant. Retrouvez toutes mes critiques sur SensCritique ![www.senscritique.com]Je ne vais pas √©crire une critique compl√®te du jeu, l'ayant d√©j√† fait pour le titre initial Ghostbusters: The Video Game. Car comme mon titre l'indique, nous avons √† faire √† un remaster fain√©ant.Pour celles et ceux qui ne le savent pas ou qui m√©langent les termes, une remasterisation est une refonte d'un jeu. D√©j√†, vous pouvez oublier une am√©lioration du gameplay, il n'y en a pas. Le contr√¥le du personnage est identique √† l'ancien titre, ce qui est dommage car sans √™tre ignoble, on ne peut pas dire que ses mouvements sont fluides.Par contre j'ai rencontr√© un bug r√©current, que je n'avais pas dans l'ancien titre. Si avec Ghostbusters: The Video Game il arrivait de rares fois qu'un fant√¥me se bloque dans le d√©cor. Ici, les fant√¥mes se bloquent tr√®s souvent hors de port√©e. Ils sont l√†, vous balancent des merdes, mais ils restent immobiles et vous ne pouvez les atteindre...Vous compterez alors sur l'IA, qui n'est pas meilleure qu'auparavant, pour r√©ussir ce qui est impossible pour vous : faire revenir ce foutu fant√¥me sur le terrain !Bon par contre ne r√™vez pas, vos co√©quipiers sont toujours aussi lents pour vous relever lorsque vous √™tes √† terre du coup comme avant, ils ne r√©ussiront pas √† venir vers vous sans se faire mettre √† terre aussi, vous obligeant √† reprendre au dernier checkpoint.La seule "am√©lioration" que vous trouverez concerne les graphismes. Mais mis √† part le fait que ce remaster est jouable en 4K √† 60fps, la refonte est douce, comme le prouve cette vid√©o comparative.Je le recommande tout de m√™me car √ßa reste un plaisir de d√©couvrir le tr√®s bon sc√©nario offert par ce jeu qui reste quand m√™me tr√®s agr√©able dans son ensemble. Et comme j'ai pu le dire pour le titre initial, il ravira les fans de la licence. Mais si vous avez le titre initial justement, vous n'aurez pas besoin de celui-ci. Si ce n'est pas le cas cependant, attendez une baisse de prix. Il co√ªte 21‚Ç¨ mais se retrouve souvent en promo √† 5‚Ç¨.

Temtem est un Pok√©mon-like qui vous fait r√©aliser ce que vous attendez dans un jeu Pok√©mon. Car si Temtem est aussi enfantin dans son histoire que son concurrent direct et propose un contenu identique, ce jeu est cependant bien plus difficile et offre des √©l√©ments que l'on attend dans chaque nouveau jeu Pok√©mon.Le syst√®me de base est familier : vous √™tes un gosse pr√™t √† partir √† la chasse aux Temtems. Pour d√©buter votre aventure, le scientifique de votre ville vous offre votre premier Temtem, que vous choisirez selon les trois qu'il vous propose. Un autre gamin est pr√©sent, qui se r√©v√®le √™tre votre rival. D'ailleurs, il vous mettra une branl√©e direct apr√®s. Le message est clair : les combats ne seront pas si simples, on y reviendra. Ainsi commence l'histoire principale, qui aura une dur√©e de vie allant jusqu'√† 50 heures. Vous ferez face √† un clan aux plans machiav√©liques, pourrez capturer 164 Temtems diff√©rents, combattrez 8 ma√Ætres de dojo... √áa ne vous rappelle rien ?Mais Temtem propose aussi son lot de qu√™tes secondaires, qui vous m√®neront par-ci par-l√† √† travers les diff√©rentes √Æles que propose le monde afin d'accomplir des objectifs divers et vari√©s. Et le tout jouable enti√®rement en coop√©ration !Vivre une aventure de ce genre avec un ami est ce que tout fan de Pok√©mon attend depuis toujours. C'est un r√©el plaisir, et permet de pimenter les combats. Car comme dit plus haut, ces derniers ne sont pas simples. Chaque combat se joue en 2 contre 2. Si en solo, vous aurez une √©quipe de 6 Temtems et en enverrez deux en m√™me temps, en coop√©ration chacun des joueurs enverra un Temtem au combat, et utilisera au total 3 Temtems de son √©quipe. Si chaque Temtem a un ou deux types, permettant donc des r√©sistances ou des faiblesses, peut apprendre 4 attaques, peut tenir un objet et poss√®de un trait qui lui est propre, il aura une barre d'√©nergie. Cette derni√®re se videra au fur et √† mesure de vos attaques, et si jamais elle est vide, alors votre Temtem sacrifiera de sa vie pour attaquer, avant d'√™tre √©reint√© pendant un tour. Cela donne une autre dimension aux combats, et permet alors un v√©ritable challenge. De plus, certaines attaques peuvent profiter d'une synergie, c'est-√†-dire que l'attaque sera plus puissante si le Temtem combattant aux c√¥t√©s de l'attaquant est du type d√©sir√© par la synergie. Et croyez-moi, les dresseurs qui seront sur votre route jouent sur la synergie et sur les types pour √™tre plus efficaces.Le PvP √©tant bien √©videmment possible, vous vous doutez que les combats comp√©titifs peuvent prendre une ampleur √©norme.Ainsi, pour monter une √©quipe parfaite, il vous faudra faire preuve de patience et capturer des Temtems ayant de bonnes statistiques. Ces derni√®res sont au nombre de 7, et peuvent profiter de bonus via les CA et les CP. Chaque statistique peut avoir un montant maximum de 50 CA, ce qui donnera 25 points bonus √† la stat concern√©e. Pour obtenir ce montant, il faut soit capturer des Temtems ayant 50 points de base dans une ou plusieurs statistiques, utiliser des objets ou les faire se reproduire. Ce point est aussi plus approfondi que dans Pok√©mon, on y vient juste apr√®s. Les CP quant √† eux peuvent √™tre de 500 maximum dans une stat, et chaque Temtem ne peut avoir plus de 1000 CP. 7 CP donnent un point dans la statistique concern√©e, ainsi un Temtem peut avoir 71 points bonus dans deux statistiques ! Pour augmenter le nombre de CP, il faudra faire combattre son Temtem face √† des Temtems sauvages sp√©cifiques, qui donneront quelques points √† une stat pr√©cise.Je vous laisse imaginer le temps que √ßa peut prendre... Si en plus vous voulez que votre Temtem soit luma (l'√©quivalent de shiny), il vous faudra √©norm√©ment de chance en prime !Pour vous aider dans l'obtention des 50 CA par statistique, la reproduction est possible. En faisant s'accoupler un Temtem m√¢le et un Temtem femelle, vous pourrez transmettre aux b√©b√©s des attaques, des traits et les CA tant d√©sir√©s. Mais cela n'est pas sans condition. Pour que deux Temtems puissent se reproduire, ils doivent √™tre jumeaux ou partager un m√™me type. Sachant que si les deux ne sont pas identiques, le Temtem √† na√Ætre sera de la lign√©e √©volutive de la m√®re. De plus, chaque Temtem ne peut se reproduire que 8 fois maximum, et cela baissera au fur et √† mesure de vos reproductions. Ainsi, la capture de nouveaux Temtems sera n√©cessaire si vous n'arrivez pas √† obtenir votre compagnon parfait rapidement.Si depuis quelques ann√©es les jeux Pok√©mon permettent d'habiller votre personnage, Temtem le propose aussi. Mais que ce soit cela ou la cr√©ation de personnage, √ßa reste du basique malheureusement. Par contre, si le visage de votre personnage semble normal, les visages des PNJ sont affreux. Ils sont plats, sans reliefs. Ce qui leur donne un air ahuri...Par contre, vous pouvez vous acheter une maison et la d√©corer. √áa n'apporte rien, mais on adore √ßa !Un contenu endgame permet √† plusieurs joueurs de rejoindre une antre tous ensemble. Ils devront alors se frayer un chemin jusqu'√† la fin de celle-ci, en combattant et en r√©cup√©rant des ressources, avant d'avoir √† combattre ensemble un Temtem mythique. Ce qui permet d'obtenir le Temtem en question, ainsi que des r√©compenses sp√©ciales.En bref, Temtem propose ce que les jeux Pok√©mon ont aussi, mais de mani√®re plus approfondie et sans vous tenir la main tout du long pour faciliter les choses tout en apportant des aspects in√©dits au genre. Mais √† la diff√©rence que le jeu est encore en acc√®s anticip√©, et que du nouveau contenu est d'ores et d√©j√† pr√©vu. Prochaine √©tape : l'ajout de montures !Par contre on regrettera le choix de l'√©criture inclusive. Lire des conneries comme "iel" ou "maon", c'est d'une d√©bilit√© sans nom.Retrouvez toutes mes critiques sur ma page SensCritique.[www.senscritique.com]

Lorsque le studio Telltale Games √©tait √† l'apog√©e de sa carri√®re, les d√©veloppeurs encha√Æn√®rent les sorties, tapant dans des licences connues et √† la mode offrant parfois d'excellentes histoires comme leur premi√®re saison de The Walking Dead ou le g√©nial Tales from the Borderlands, des histoires int√©ressantes comme pour leur jeu sur Game of Thrones et la seconde saison de The Walking Dead et parfois des catastrophes comme 400 Days ou Michonne...Alors en visant Minecraft, √† quoi pouvait-on s'attendre ? Je veux dire, bien que ce ne soit pas un jeu qui a pour vocation de narrer des l√©gendes de son univers, √©norm√©ment de cr√©ations de fan ont pris de l'ampleur, au point de devenir des romans ou des bande-dessin√©es.Mais c'est toujours plut√¥t enfantin... Et c'est le cas ici aussi.Le sc√©nario, sans √™tre tr√©pidant, se montre simple. Il se d√©couvre une fois, mais ne vous attirera pas pour une seconde d√©couverte, non, m√™me pas pour d√©couvrir les r√©sultats de choix diff√©rents de votre premier passage.Par contre, chez Telltale Games ce sont des enfoir√©s ! Il y a UN moment triste dans ce jeu. Et ils m'ont fait rire pendant. C'est diabolique !Le monde de Minecraft est respect√©, que ce soit dans le bestiaire ou encore ses biomes, mais il est logique que d√©couvriez des choses qui n'existent pas dans le jeu initial. Pas d'inqui√©tude, cela ne d√©nature pas l'univers !Mais les d√©veloppeurs ne prennent une fois de plus aucun risque et nous offre un jeu identique aux autres.On n'a pas l'impression que les choix ont un v√©ritable impact sur la suite de l'histoire, les QTE sont omnipr√©sentes, mais ne suivent aucun rythme et il y a encore et toujours ces passages inutiles dans lesquels vous devrez faire faire trois pas √† votre personnage avant de d√©buter une nouvelle cin√©matique...La seule nouveaut√© est le fait que vous pouvez choisir d'incarner un homme ou une femme.C'est peu.Si vous √™tes un grand joueur de Minecraft, un fan absolu, un mordu de d√©couverte, ce jeu pourrait vous plaire.Si cet univers ne vous parle pas sp√©cialement, peut-√™tre devriez-vous vous diriger sur un autre titre...Retrouvez mes critiques sur SensCritique ![www.senscritique.com]

This game is such great value for the money. Tons of weapons, characters, and builds to experiment with. Great music and sound effects, this is a game you can really get lost in. Not to mention you can actually improve and get better, from my first couple runs until now there is a night and day improvement I've seen in myself.

If you've enjoyed Yakuza games in the past you'll love this one, The main difference is this one is turn based combat. Serious moments, hilarious moments, emotional moments, side quests as great as the main story. This game has it all and was my 2020 GOTY hands down.
This is our reward for surviving 2020.

a fun AFK type game (once you get into the later stages of the game, the further along you get the longer your runs can go with minimal intervention). with lots of combinations to play with, addicting to leave running in the background and work on personal goals such as getting a super high FPH or just pushing into super high levels. Fun game if you're into that sort of thing and enjoy numbers that keep getting bigger and bigger. Overall a fun game and you can't complain when its F2P, everything in the game that can be purchase with real money can be gained for free quite easily so take your time and have fun with it!

This is a really fun game to pass the time, you can always improve to get better and their are lots of skins/battle pass type system which always keeps you wanting the next reward. There are still some hackers in the game unfortunately but the devs seem to be doing a great job to ban their accounts. This gives me the mario party vibes of my childhood so I will be playing this game for quite some time to come, can't wait to see what future seasons will bring!
Building, Exploration, Efficiency. I'm addicted, please send help.

This version of NBA2K is definitely my favourite so far, if you enjoy the career mode then you will love this game. The gameplay is fantastic and all of the voice commentary is taken from actual NBA games so it makes it feel very real. However, if you are a HUGE fan of playing the NBA All-Star weekend, DO NOT BUY THIS GAME!The dunk contest controls are absolutely awful. Guitar Hero controls make absolutely no sense whatsoever in terms of replicating the feel of someone completing a slam dunk. Further, the controls were meant to be "fun friendly", for casual gamers to pick up and succeed. In contrast, I actually found completing a dunk and winning a contest in 2K13 was much more difficult in both regards than its predecessors found in previous 2K's. And again, at no point do we ever feel we're in control of what's happening on the court. Absolutely no correlation.The 3pt. Contest was just incredibly clunky. There was, in fact, a shooting groove to be found. But, under no circumstances do I feel a gamer's lack of ability to find a groove should be punished with complete controller unresponsiveness. In short, the mode offered virtually no fun, just frustration and confusion.In summary I only recommend this game if you don't care about the NBA All-Star weekend, if that aspect doesn't interest you then this game is absolutely amazing, if they can fix this for future games then it would be near perfect.

+ Varied Gameplay for Casual or Hardcore experience+ Fun game to play+ The ability to import any song your heart desires+ If it reminds me of anything I've played before I would have to say Guitar HeroIf you can get this game on sale like I did for $0.99 you definitely won't regret it.
+ Graphics+ Detail in the Pinball Tables+ Fun and Relaxing+ Outstanding Pinball experience- Paying for the different tables you want to unlock

Just played Chapter 1 and all I can say is WOW! If you're a fan of The Walking Dead game then this is a must buy,+ Outstanding voice acting+ Great art style+ Amazing story+ Making choices that have consequences

I've been following this game for a while, however I never spent the money to buy alpha access. Now that it's on steam I've finally had a chance to give it a shot, and so far, it is living up to it's promises. although there are still issues here and there. The dev team has released it in early access as such. In fact, from all of the correspondence from the devs it seems that they did not plan on releasing on Steam this early, but had to to keep being able to generate keys for the game from steam for supporters. So the devs seem to understand that the game is no where near a final state yet, and are working on it.That being said, what is already here is very solid. The AI can actually do a lot. And although there are issues and changes, the AI is definitely there. The gameplay is also already quite solid, with multiple approaches to situations. Animation and graphics are also really solid thus far.I would recommend this game if you are interested in the 'SWAT' style tactical FPS game, but be warned that there are definitely still issues, and missing content. But otherwise, having played about an hour, I am quite excited for where this game is going!

Okay, So I picked this game up through the Jingle Jam donation reward bundle.And when I saw this game initially, I was not all that interested, from looking at the screenshots it was not really something I was all too interested in with the artstyle and general look/ feel of the game.However, after playing the game. I can very much recommend. It creates a fantastic world and universe around your characters, and the closest videogame comparison I can find being something like divinity original sin with world-building. Another great comparison is DnD, it's like a DnD game, but with pre-made art and scripts which do genuinely give depth to the customizable characters.I along with a group of friends who also picked up the game in the Jingle Jam, decided to jump on and give it a shot, and in the past 2 days we've played about 8 hours, and completed one of the campaigns in the game. And I can tell you it was a blast. With each of us taking on the role of our character, and reading off the lines in the fully illustrated stories, as well as just having general fun with splitting loot and fighting for the controls at times. It was just a great time.I can very much recommend this game, there is a lot you can do, and a lot that can happen. So I very much recommend this game!If you've read this far, and are on the fence about getting the game. Just do it. You won't regret it.
crob game

Click Cookies,Overturn the universe and beyond with your cookie empire,Hire some grandmas to bake cookies for you,Make the grandmas mad at you,Chill out to C418's chill as soundtrack,Survive the grandmapocalypse.As can be seen from my short summary above, cookie clicker is a perfectly normal mass production cookie baking game with no horror stories in it at all...

Josef, You've done it again!It Takes Two is absolutely fantastic. The link between story and game-play is honestly unlike any other game (Apart from A Way Out) I've played. From travelling through white water rapids, to being kidnapped by giant squirrels, the story and game-play never gets old or ceases to amaze. Just for some background; at it's core, It Takes Two is a story-driven, 2-player co-op puzzle game, with game-play that genuinely never stops changing. The main game is split into 'chapters' where each chapter let's you play around and solve puzzles with different gadgets. As well as sometimes throwing completely different types of games at you ranging from street fighter to rhythm game. Even without the story, if you enjoy puzzle games, this will be a blast, and a lot of fun. The story however, ties it all together so well that it just blends it into one amazing masterpiece!With a single play-through time of about 12 hours- The game managing to stay new and fresh throughout- And a great story to tie it all together, this game is Absolutely Brilliant!
When the prentender doesn't pretend

Melvor is just Runescape, but with botting being the main gameplay, and all the extra quirks removed. It doesn't require you to do quests, run around gathering different ingredients for some cook, fighting frozen beasts with enchanted fires, or anything of that sort. It simply gives you the option to choose what to grind out, and then works for you, even when you are not online. It's an idle game, if you like(d) Runescape, you'll love Melvor. Very much recommend,And don't forget the golbins
Step 1: Blow LeavesStep 2: Spend Blown Leaves on upgradesStep 3: ??Leaf Portal/ Big Crunch??Step 4: Profit!?

I've played Apex Legends on and off for quite a while, since about season 2 on origin. I've never really gotten into the game too much, as I do not usually enjoy the battle royale gameplay style too much.Apex legends however, always lures me back by the fun gunplay and innovative mechanics. I found that on origin, the playerbase was very experienced and I found it hard to play the game after taking a break for a while. On steam however, the game is much more accessible to someone who has never played before, as the majority of the games that I am joining have champion squads (The 'best' squad that game) who are low level and do not have many kills on their characters. Where, if I'd join a match on origin nearly every champion squad would have thousands if not tens of thousands of kills.Overall, I definitely recommend. It's free after all. Give it a shot!

It's good.It's almost one of the 'press r to restart' sort of games, especially when you're trying to get a better time on a level. The gameplay is smooth, the best way I can describe the experience is a mix of Titanfall-like movement, with Hotline Miami like enemies, while all being combined in a 3D environment. The time-slow is best compared to something like SUPERHOT.Overall, a great story, and fun gameplay. Definitely recommended

I'm recommending the game, because it runs well and I didn't experience any issues (rare in 2018 with a game made in 2012 on the PC).   It's not a hard recommendation, but if it's reasonably-priced it may be worth picking up if you're into Batman.Slightly too repetitive to start the game, and the objective tracking + open world combination takes you off the beaten path quickly, not in a good way.    Once you make it beyond the belltower bomb explosion (first 45 minutes of the game), the confusing open world aspect kicks-in.I think the combat, upgrades, etc could be interesting if you can make sense of the game enough to get there.I may try to push through the game in the future.    Afterall, it's Batman.

The game was probably better in 2009, but in 2018 without a frame of reference on the original game it's not worth picking up.   I'm a huge Star Wars fan, and I wouldn't recommend this game to someone unless they have some attachment to the original game.

The retro look and feel is solid, the space-theme is nifty, the items and abilities are fun and most importantly you can dig holes in the ocean floor and watch it flood caverns full of annoying creatures that try to harm you.    Also there's lava and penguins with machine guns, so you can check that box off.

Just to be clear, I never played the original Insurgency and I am kinda new to this sequel aswell. The only thing I brought when I started playing Insurgency: Sandstorm was my aim, which I have trained over years in Battlefield, Rainbow Six Siege and so on. And to be honest, aim is definetly not the most important thing here, I can tell you that. I died SO MANY TIMES because of camping enemies and so on. This truely is a hardcore shooter. Maybe not as mil-sim like ARMA III, but damn close. The community is rather friendly and is always up for jokes. Sure, there are some toxic people aswell, but most of the community is chilled. Damn I love this game and I can reccomend it to any Shooter or Hardcore-Shooter fan. 11/10, would buy over and over again.

Well, the "safezones" are quite small, but for singleplayer and private servers this is great. Also, since those safezones are so small, and the corrupted dinos around them living in the wasteland can destroy even tek structures, I can imagine the sh*tshow going off on pvp servers while fighting over tjose safezones. Can't wait to join those fights. Over all, if you like it difficult, play this dlc. It truely is a great end to the ARK lore. That exactly is what I expected from a final challenge. All the titans roaming around, corrupted dinos, the orbital drops, everything. 10/10 would buy over and over again.

Well, here I am with my almost 200 hours of playtime. I think it's safe to say that I'm able to write a review. Or maybe not, cause the content in the base game is endless. And oh, there are mods... I think you get my point. You can spend countless hours in this game. Two DLCs already released and a third one, ARK: Extinction is already on it's way with the release date being November 6th. It's amazing content, and there's lots of it. Season pass totally worth it if you haven't bought the expansions yet. While the Summer Sale 2018 is going on, you can grab yourself a copy of ARK and the season pass for little money.WARNING: Multiplayer on official servers is kinda equal to cancer, since alpha tribes will totally destroy you. I recommend playing on unofficial or private servers.Should you get the game? If you have a decent PC and like to play survival games, this is one of the best ones out there.Just buy it and ask questions later, you won't regret it.

Ich habe auch schon etwas √ºber 40 Euro in Ingame Money investiert (3,6M $), und bin eigentlich zufrieden wobei man bei dem Geld mehr verlangen k√∂nnte. Sehr Empfehlenswert.

It is a short but nice game for the price can't complain too much .Story wise is not anything new but still enjoyable for a click point kind of game with easy achivements and nice art work .So i leave this to you because this is a 50/50 for me 5/10 .

Industria is a nice sci-fi game that you can see that takes has inspiration games such a Half-life and BioShock .It is a fun game with a nice story too bad it is kinda short do hope they make a sequel to it ,the ending was kind of a cliffhanger .The game is a bit clunky has a first person shooter but not the end of the world .It was a fun game and like I said do hope they make a second part , I give this game 6.5/10

How a mobile game can actually be amusing.( I don't owne mobile games )The jokes on the side the game is actually fun to play and the story is well written and funny has well , short but for what it is it is worth the money but I leave that to your judgement ,and also an easy game to complete .I rate this game a 6.5/10.

Foregone is a good and fun metroidvania-lite like and it draws a lot of it's inspiracion from dead cells and such but still it has its charm , nice soundtrack and s mode gameplay unfortunately not pixel art but still good for killing a few hours , i give this one 6.5/10 .

I do believe someone is bit too much of a fan of Tim Burton and Alice in the Wonderland , not a bad thing don't get me wrong i did have a good time playing this 3rd person platform and enjoy every minute of it not only in the history but gameplay has well , even if it's not everyone's cup cake .A very good story with memorable characters and a really nice soundtrack to complement the game , this game is a must if you enjoy platforms 8/10 on my book .

From the creators of Dead Cells come this beautiful but short platformer with a few easter eggs .I do hope they're next game has a bit more to do and is a bit longer has well but still worth it , 7/10 .
Fun horror rpg with a great story about spirits gruges and how they should move on in the after life .This game is a 7.5/10 for me even if its a bit short but quite a few endings .

Have you ever wonder how a life cycle of a rock is form , this will takes us on a journey to the womb of such creature .It will show us the rise of one rock named "Endgiver" , lets follow the birth of such a magnificent creature and his daily life where he smash rocks to eat rocks from the weakest to the strongest all of this in the name of survival .With narracion of David Attenborough ( he may or may not be narrating since we are paying with gibber stone and pebbles ) but you can see this and a lot more in National Geographic .( National Geographic theme song ) (7.5/10)

Death's door is a beautiful hack & slash that show us the journey of a crow that has the job of collecting souls and it gets him self tangle in a very obscure tale which envolves immortals and death it self.This game has a very simplistic story but very well written the music it is very enjoyable and on spot with the game this is totally worth the money, i do give this one 7.5/10.

Normally I would wait until i finish the game/am very close to the ending to post a review however I think i can make an exception this time. As of right now i have 3 hours in the game therefore the review won't be too long but I still want to make the devs aware of some stuff that I found some very funny some a bit game breaking because you can soft lock. The first thing I noticed and found pretty funny is that if you jump on a barrel or explosive barrel they just shrink or fall under the map. The second thing it's a bit more serious. The best way to describe this is with 2 solid examples. In the first map as you stay up on the platform with the flames coming out of the floor that you can shoot fall in the kitchen area, and in front of you the big blue door; Look the the right and head to the stairs, for some reason a very weird thing happens when your character wants to fall down from a platform to another and it gets stuck in a invisible wall or smt. You can't get out of it (I tried ). In the second map; there is this secret on the roof top for which you have to go to the tower structure do some parkour jumps. When you jump from a platform to another your character gets stuck on the platform they are already on and therefore making it hard to jump or remain stuck there. I think those were the main issues I found HOWEVER with all of these being said the game is still amazing; if you look at the demo and the first map side by side ; you can see how much love and effort was put into this game. The secrets may seem a bit complicated but they are very rewarding. The mechanics and gameplay evolved so much from the first game and in my opinion it's really fun. That doesn't mean you shouldn't check out the first game as well; it's a really good game. P.S: the fully automatic shotgun combine with the Q power up (the one that gives you the weapon in the other hand as well ) makes my day better. So over all, I think:Gameplay:8/10Story: I will update when I will finish the game Map Design: 10/10Enemies: 9/10Weapons:9/10+tons of content to enjoy

Dread Templar ... woaw... I have to say that I didn't make a review in a very long time but I think this game deserve one. From the 2 episodes I've played I realized that not only it is very fun to throw a katana through monsters but the classic retro style is more alive than ever.Strong points: +The story telling is simple as it should be+Gameplay is very fluid feels+Weapons feel so punchy +Each type of monster is unique in it's own way; forcing the player enemy prioritization (in specially in higher difficulties )+The Super secrets are awesome in specially the Easter Egg ones (want to know which ones ? play the game)+No fps drops; crashes; there was just this one rock that you can get behind and see through the map but it's hard to find Areas where improvement is welcomed: -As much as I love the super secrets; for the very special ones there should be separate achievements -If you are like me and go for 100% kills and secrets; a few secrets are a bit cryptic others are like " why is this a secret ? " -I understand giving the player extra stuff on higher difficulties but since at the end you don't really get rewarded for completing the 2 episodes on the highest difficulty (achievement wise ) ; why not unlock the extra areas for all difficulties ? And about the ep 2 boss: He's fine ; he's a final episode boss it's meant to be a challenge; GIT GUD

When it comes to wolfenstein i played almost every single one of them ( i didn't play those that were before wolf 3d ) ; but to be fair i was never more disappointed into a Wolfenstein more then i am now ; why in the world would you turn wolf into a co-op RPG ? and on top of that not even have stable connection  ; the only things good about this game is the fact that i can play it with my husband ; the graphics ; the characters and the references and easter eggs ;  but that doesn't change the fact that enemies have now health bars ; stealth mechanic is not viable ; in fact the only viable gun in this game it's the max upgraded shotgun ; you don't have the liberty of killing like in the previous 3 "new school " games ; the quests aren't that well done  and as much as i am trying to enjoy this game for the story line ; i just can't get over the issues that this game has ....Do i recommend this game ? No ; not really ; it's a lot better to play Old Blood ; New Order and New Colossus if you want to have a taste of the new school wolfenstein Also to Bethesda : Please don't ruin The Elder Scrolls and Doom ; you already failed with Young Blood ; Fallout 76 and Rage 2

Shadow Warrior  II ; I have to admit that my hopes for this game were so so so so so high ; yet I remained a little bit disappointed. The game itself works alright ; with smooth movement and actions ; but it just doesn‚Äôt feel the same. Why ? because the main Katana from what I played so far ; it is 100% useless no matter what upgrades I put on it ; the weapons that I got weren‚Äôt ‚Äúdeserved‚Äù (like in the first game) ;I  just bought them with in-game money from Larry and put those ‚Äúrune ‚Äú type items on them to give them special effects and a little bit of damage buff. The enemies have quite an interesting design ; but  why do they need to have a health bar ? why don‚Äôt they just die when you shoot them with a shotgun for example or slash them with the Katana ; again just like in the first game. Perhaps it‚Äôs because of the co-op aspect of the game but even so ; why not implement this feature in the ‚Äúmultiplayer ‚Äú section only ; since there is an option to play singleplayer as well as multiplayer . When it comes down to the map design ; the places are beautiful all into their own way from the forests ; to temples ; to towns ; to the cyberpunk city and to the little secret areas ; some of the secret areas being full of Easter eggs and references and umm... holograms ... yeeess .Into the story I didn‚Äôt manage to progress as much as I would like to ; but so far it seems decent ; with a little bit of throwback to the Shadow Warrior 1 game .Ratings:The one and only Wang : 10/10 Enemies: 8.2/10Gameplay: 8/10 Weapons : 6/10 (I get it ; there are a lot of weapons but what for ; it‚Äôs not as complex as in the first game ; plus they murdered the main Katana ) Storyline: ---/10 (I will update when I will finish the game ) All and all ; the game in my opinion shouldn't be called Shadow Warrior ; it‚Äôs a nice and fun game that you can play with your friends ; again NOT as a shadow warrior game but more like a run and gun game (from what I experienced so far ; if  somehow  the game will manage to change as I progress deeper into the storyline then perhaps but until then it‚Äôs not even close to a shadow warrior game ) P.S: please don‚Äôt make anymore shadow warrior games by taking so much inspiration from the Borderlands ; I get that Shadow Warrior 1 as well as Borderlands (all of them ) are indeed great games ; but let‚Äôs not combine them and call it Shadow Warrior 2.

Metro Last Light (a sequel to Metro 2033) it's one of my favorite post-apocalyptic games ; the story goes like this: you play as a ranger called Artyom living in Moscow's metro system (after a nuclear war ) along with many other people that found refuge here.You are suppose to find the creature called "the dark one " but before completing your task ; you get captured by the Reich ; and so your advanture in the metro begins needing to fight different factions and mutated monsters The game by itself looks so pretty in special if you are a fan of post-apocalyptic games Over all i really enjoyed this game and the special missions as well:Story 9/10 (there are 2 different endings )Characters: 10/10Graphics: 8/10Gameplay 9/10

in my opinion Limbo is the proof that you don't really need words or fancy graphics to make an amazing puzzle-platform game ; but when it comes down to the story line ; here it's like a double edge sword ; you can interpret it ; or see other theories from other players it's up to you.The simple black and white design gives to the game a nuance of creepy (that and the huge spider ; the few people that you meet in the game and they either try to kill you or run away from you and many more ) Overall i recommand this game -Gameplay 10/10 (easy character movement ; no bugs )                                                    -Graphics  8/10 (despide of the modest look that the game might give you at first ; it's one of those games where you have to try it out for yourself to see so much detail in such few things )                                                     -Characters 7/10                                                     -Storyline .... ummmm .... well it's a discussable subject ; as  i said it depeds how you interpret the hole thing ; for exaple it is said that Limbo is the world that make connection with human world and whatever is beyond death (like a shadow world which would make sense ); or limbo for the latin "limbus" - meaning edge ; so perhaps edge of death . (so it remains up to you to decide about the story line )

in my opinion this is a very good game ; another classic brought back to life ; the story follows a modern ninja warrior Lo Wang  (Mister 2 Million dollars) in his searching for the Nobitsura Kage a legendary katana shattered in 3 different swords ; along the game you will fight demos and humans from time to time ; the easter eggs are amazing making referece to the good old Shadow Warrior 3D Overall Story 8/10             Gameplay 10/10             Protagonist 9/10 (Nobody's perfect )              Characters (enemies; hoji ; the ummm thing that can be found at the end of the road in the first level and in front of the gamestrore in the second level and the naked pixeled ladies ) 10/10

I personally love this game ; the games follows the story of an ex-S.W.A.T. called Adam Jensen that becomes the victim of a terrorist attack at Sarif Industries HQ and needs to become augmented in order to survive; the rest of the story is up to you to discover and believe me ; you won't regret it Ummm overall gameplay 10\10 Storyline 8\10 Characters 10\10

In it's current state, I can only recommend this game on sale - deep discount 70%+. Many of the pre and post release promises have not even been addressed at this time. It is a beautiful game but the grind, redundancy combined with clunky control of combat and driving is outrageously poor.You will enjoy the story and the graphics but the rest needs a lot of work. The story is not extensive and I don't feel there is much replay value within the story - at this time. They seem to still care about this game so hopefully it will continue to improve.I have this game on 2 accounts and finished the story (on my GOG) in about 35 hours.I would say the game is not much fun to comeback to after story completion. Saints Row Third (with a linear story) is still a favorite of mine - a game that I still replay today.

This has become a fast favorite of mine. I love deck building games and this has some of that element. It is an easy game to learn but offers a fair challenge once you feel you have a clear understanding of the card combos you can achieve through the various faction pairs. A 'Run Through' (Game) consists of 6 or 7 sections with your chosen faction pair. Each section allows you to boost/buff your deck with a new artifact, new card, or new card enhancements. Then you 'fight' to proceed to the next section until you reach a final Boss section. New cards are unlocked along the way (win or lose). A game like this is perfect and relaxing for me while I am listening to a book or when I may be called away at a moment for work or other. Easily my favorite game of 2020 thus far.

This is a great concept for a card game. This is a Dungeon crawler of sorts that centers on building the Talent Pool (card pool) of a Character Type rather than the individual character. So a character you named -Conan--who is a Barbarian- will die but now the next Barbarians that spawn will have more cards to use in the next Dungeon. The game will seem a bit difficult in the beginning but you will learn how to use the cards to your characters benefit.When I started playing I wasn't sure until I understood that failing a dungeon actually helps you grow your deck pool. So basically 5-10 minutes and I was hooked for over 80 Hours of play. If you have trouble enjoying the game in the beginning it is probably because -like me- you want your characters to live. Just give it some time and you will enjoy this addicting little game.This is a game I would come back to play.
Very relaxing, fun storyline. You feel like you're virtually hiking and then there is the mystery that keeps your interest for a complete playthrough. Nice - Refreshing - Simply Fun.

This is a casual FPS from 2013 with a decent storyline that I highly recommend. This game is a merging of a casual horror/mystery and Portal. It is one of the few games I would take the time to play again. I would like to see more from the creators at Wales Interactive.

10 out of 10Evil Pumpkin is the perfect game for Halloween and a wonderful HOG/PAC despite some of the negative reviews. This is an Advanced Hidden Object so it is not for n00bs to the genre. This game seems to focus more on Puzzles and Point and Click than Hidden Object and the atmosphere is perfect for Halloween. The story is fun and keeps you engaged. This game is not difficult unless you are relatively new to 'point and click' games. You will have to use your brain to solve some of the puzzles but nothing too difficult. There are guides if you are not sure what to do next -which I used a few times. My 5th grade niece played through the game without any issue. I found this game pleasantly challenging in parts so it is not so 'mindless' as some of the more basic entries in this genre. I was able to earn all the achievements.All HOG/PAC developers should pay attention to this game.  I would love to see more games like this.Highly recommend to anyone wishing for a true challenge in the Point and Click/Hidden Object genre.

Highly recommended.This is a great game. I put about 200 hours into this. If you enjoy defense strategy like Defense Grid or Orcs Must Die then this is for you. It seems easy at first but it becomes more difficult as you play. You will receive a true challenge on the very hard and the newgame+ levels. What I liked most about this game is that you can play the game relaxed or increase the difficulty for a real challenge. The storyline is decent and keeps you engaged. If you find yourself in a challenging spot for newgame+, I would encourage researching level up and placement ideas. Lots of fun and well worth the $$. I will be purchasing the next release.

This game is a must for anyone that likes crime drama or detective noir. This is not GTA. GTA is more like Saints Row which are both great games but not much like this game. LA Noire is more like Mafia or Hard Rain set in the post WW2 era but it plays more like a movie. So the equation: ((HR x 2) + M) may be a start.What the game lacks in action it makes up for in story. It will draw you in -I played it straight through which is unusual for me. While solving the main story mystery there are mini-games/crimes that will show up. Some of the mini crimes tie into the main storyline but are not essential. They are great if you feel the need for some action. There are also cars, badges and film reels scattered about that you can collect in a Free Roam Mode.The only issue I had was the 30FPS cap on the game which can make the game seem choppy at times but it doesn't ruin the game. This is a great game and I am looking foward to the next installment. I recommend buying all the DLC with this game before you play since it adds so much to the story.

There is absolutely NO reason why you should not own this game if you play CS or L4D. It is like Counter-Strike because it is mission based. It is like L4D because you must stick together or you will die. Introducing Skill Tree elements into the game allow you to adjust to your desired play style. You can be a tank, controller, technician, or stealth. You can respec over time. I have already had many hours in this game and it is clearly one of my favorites.
LOADS of James Bondish like humor and fun in this strategy/build/defense game. Plenty of depth esp considering this was a 2004 release. Definately worth checking out.

While the gameplay itself isn't very good the game really takes the cake when it comes to the story. While I wouldn't say it breaks the 4th wall extremely well or gives the player meaningfull choices that they regret later. It takes a different perspective on war and what being a soldier is really like. Don't get me wrong, you're still an andrenaline fuelled tank effortlessly mowing down soldiers, but instead of you being completely sure that you are doing the right thing, there are hints thrown in that make you question wether what you're doing is right. Not to mention the incredible finale that you have to experience for yourself.This game definitely shows that even when the protagonist is essentially a god you can still craft a copelling and memorable narrative around him.

Doesn't hold your hand at all and that is a big issue, but discovering things on your own bring about the same kind of feeling that you had when exploring WoW or Runescape and finding something useful and you previously didn't know about, so there are benefits and negatives to this approach, but if you do learn the game through guides/wikis or simply exploring, you will find a great game with a lot of content, especially since they started adding the story.

Great game, I am very glad that HumbleBundle was giving it out for free and certainly recommend buying it for anyone who likes shooters and strategy games.To start off, the guarateed crash during the tutorial can either be fixed by updating the PhysX file in the game, or by disabiling all the PhysX effects. I did the latter, reason for why I am saying this? Well it seems that some people have buggy AI that keeps running out of cover and dying. PhysX might have something to do with it, I ain't an expert though. For me the AI works just like in ant other game where you have AI companions, yes they have suicidal tendencies, but I never felt like they were constanly running Into enemy fire and I was playing on the "hard" difficulty. It is certainly tough at the start, when you aren't acustomes to the main focus of combat, which are the abilities that your soldiers have. I felt like the world was stacked against me when I started the game, but 2-3 hours in I noticed that I only died to stupid mistakes, rather than the AI acting dumb. In fact I only lost one soldier throughout the campaign and that was in my first hour when I still didn't quite get the abilities.Personally being a big fan of these strategy and shooter hybrids, I really enjoyed the campaign and certainly wouldn't say that this isn't worth 15‚Ç¨.

What I talk about after this paragraph has happened a while ago, since then Rockstar and Take Two have retracted their decision and Open IV still lives. I personally would say that the game is definitely worth it even without the mods that are offered by Open IV, but removing them is a low blow and this is why I can't push myself to recommend this game, because this decision might come back later to haunt the player in the GTA V universe. Lucky for us, that day is not today.Open IV was a popular tool that a lot of modders used to make their mods for GTA V. Note that the developer of Open IV himself had to confirm that the mod/tweak DOESN'T allow you to CHEAT online. If the game was modded, GTA ONLINE simply WOULDN'T LAUNCH.Both Take Two and Rockstar used cheaters as an excuse for taking down this tool, because it is bad for their shark card business. If you have a game that is modded to ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•, why would you play online? You have fun in single player, so you won't get into the grindfest that is GTA online. Take Two and Rockstar know that and they have ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô• excuse to ban the tool.TotalBiscuit made a great video talking about this and even comparing the decision to Bethesda's creator club.https://youtu.be/8hLmM6pK0wg?t=28m33s

This game... Ughhhh... This game...I just finished the game and the extra chapter and let me tell you... The story is so ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô• complicated, that even after playing through it one more time. I still don't understand wtf is going on. "The Last Chapter" (so is the free dlc called) helps uncovers some more story behind the main character Sgt. Burden and I would even compare the depht of the story to other devolver digital title "Hotline Miami", they both have a story that when finished makes you cofused as hell and realised that you did all of what you did, for nothing basically. This game more leans for existential crisis, thinking of how little you mean in the vast universe.So now to the gameplay and holy $hit this game is hard on the original difficulty. I being a dude that always picks "normal" when it comes to game difficulty, am a stubborn bastard and learn to adapt to the game in order to win, but this game has bested me and I had to lower the difficulty of it, just to barely manage beating it. Now if you hate the RNG this game also has a "puzzle" mode that bypasses as much of rng as possible, to provide you with a more of a puzzle rather than strategy feel. But it ain't just a generic point & click, but rather more of a strategy game on original mode having you manage various resources and people, trying to ensure your survival (in this game most of the people are expendable)So if you enjoy games that are harder than balls of steel, then this game is for you, just pick a mode that suits you and roll. Also if you're a story type of guy (like me) then this game is also for you, since they even have a "narrative" mode that is like COD and let's you skim through the challenges with ease (It took me ~1hr to beat the game on narrative mode after beating it on original light which took me ~5hrs and a wish to kill myself from all the tries.)

Someone has recommended me this game, and to be honest, I wasn't really sure at first. I bought it, hoping that I didn't waste money into a game I didn't like. As I went through the game, I was a bit lost at first, but I always am when I start a game lol. I ended up absolutely LOVING IT. The only thing I am sad about, is that I played this game for a countless number of hours for a few days, and finished it. I felt like there was so much into the game, but not enough story. However, as I looked back at it, that wasn't actually the case. I had just played this game for way longer than I thought... I was simply sad that it ended because I enjoyed it so much. I would definitely recommend this game, but if you get it, I suggest you play it with some friends. I rarely enjoy games that much, and in this case, I was pleasantly surprised!PS: If you decide to give the game a try, make sure you get the DLC for The Following as well. It's basically new things in the game, more story, more everything. It was definitely worth it!

Survarium is an online multiplayer shooter set in stalker's universe. The game is free to play or should I say was free because the game ends its life by the end of May 2022. I decided to come back to the game for its remaining days and I am super disappointed. Let me start with what I find the most frustrating about this game and these are campers. The community of this game is awful. The majority of playerbase is to no one's surprise from Russia. Russian communities tend to be toxic and this is exactly the case in this situation. Beside that everyone, EVERY SINGLE PLAYER is camping like crazy. I have yet to meet a player in this game that isn't hidden behind a corner or a tree. This combined with terrible visibility makes the game really frustrating to play. Don't get me wrong, I find the graphical side of this game incredibly good but I don't think it goes well with a genre like this one. Let's move to pay to win aspect of the game. The game has faction system. To get better gear you have to grind one of 4 factions and once you level up you have access to a bit better items. These new items aren't much better than the ones you had unlocked a level before. If you want to level up one faction to the maximum it should take you at least a few hundred hours. You can also just purchase items of higher levels in a shop for special currency that is only obtainable by real money. The gear you can buy gives you even better statistics and bonuses than the items from maxed out faction. It doesn't even make the grind worth it. Players who put few hundred hours into the game will still be on the disadventage against a player who spent real money. It's pathetic.What is also worth mentioning is bots. These guys have aimbot, wallhack and other similar things. You might even be behind one and start shooting at it but you are likely to die first anyway. They will just quickly turn around and kill you within half a second. You don't have to play bot games to find one. They are also on official servers taking free spots which are reserved for the players. Playing with or against bots is a complete opposite of fun in this game.Another thing I wanted to mention is achievements. Good 90% of them require either hundreds of hours, luck or cheats. These are not well written achievements. Let me give you an example: win a game with 50 kills and 0 deaths or have a game with 75 kills. These are only obtainable on an online match against players. I have tried to have it done with bots as well as on custom match I hosted to no result. Its impossible to get unless the whole enemy team is afk or you are cheating. Now with the game shutting down its servers, we are going to be stuck with these achievements for good, being unable to complete them. That's the scenario for us unless developers actually remove these achievements, but I wouldn't hope for it. They are well-known for not listening to their playerbase.In my opinion the game from mechanical and graphical side is great but I wouldn't recommend it. Unappealing community and achievements have definitely ruined the game for me. My ingame experience has also been mostly negative. I m glad that the game is dying and I regret playing it.

Endless World is a clicker genre game. We idle while our hero and his team of 4 marcenaries are going through groups of monsters and levels. That's how we progress.At first glance, the game looks very nice and different from other clicker games, but in reality it is not. Everything is based on rewinding time, which resets your progress. In other games this is optional, and unfortunately it is required to unlock newer options in this game, which is a big minus for me personally.Everything is fine until we reach level 270 and we have to fight boss named Eve. To kill this boss all we need to do is to use mechanics of the game and only then we are able to see how much the mechanics of the game doesn't work properly. The game is very poorly written and the mechanics do not work as they should.While progressing through further levels, we can encounter other players and we are forced to fight them. I don't like this feature and it gets annoying over time. Players should not be forced into pvp, if they dont want to. Pvp should be optional and it is not, especially in a clicker game. It takes a lot of time and the rewards are not even that good. It is a waste of time.Another unappealing thing is sprint, which is a two-day race to the highest level possible in exchange for prizes. Why unappealing? Because the game is pay2win and spending real money gives you a huge advantage over others, so racing is pointless if you don't want to pay. If that wasn't enough, developers came up with a great idea that for finishing the race at at least top 20 position there is an achievement. So if you are achievement hunter, it's best for you to avoid this game, because reaching the top 20 is a miracle, unless you want to spend real money or two whole days of your life.Of course, the game is free and definitely worth trying, but unfortunately due to the things I listed above I cannot recommend the game. It was mostly a negative experience for me.

Shooters like Battalion 1944 live and die by how they are supported. At the launch out of early access in June 2019, the game had a competent start for a low-profile shooter with nearly 10,000 CCU. That number has since dropped to about a tenth of what it once was.As its playerbase spirals downward (leaving certain regions dead), most people who are still left defending Battalion 1944 say it will "get better" after they ship some updates from their roadmap. They mention that support will continue for "years to come." The CEO of the developer, Bulkhead, routinely posts on reddit to reaffirm that they are focused on squashing bugs and shipping content. They should be; the game is caught in a trajectory similar to that of 2017's notorious blunder Lawbreakers.On more than one occasion, however, the developer not only refuses to take consumer issues seriously, but passive aggressively attacks them for criticizing the game. Hit registration problems and unreliable anti-cheat are two hot topics in the Battalion 1944 community, and posts by users on the subreddit that discuss these issues (among others) have historically been locked or deleted at the request of the developer. The CEO gave up his moderation rights on the subreddit recently to comply with the site's EULA, but his tone whenever he posts has not changed: "we're not trying to deny these problems exist, we just don't want factually incorrect information to spread."Bulkhead are quick to defend their actions by saying users are spreading "false information." The problem with this approach is that, as the developer, you are permanently inserting your professional opinion that the issue has been looked into and decided upon. Users are now far less likely to look for ways to fix such basic issues as hit registration *for your benefit* because of the continual vilification of such discussion on the Battalion 1944 subreddit. Any healthy developer of a healthy game would react very differently. They would try to silently alter the conversation by trying to reproduce what users are talking about and fixing the issues they detect. The most useful conversations your users can have, Bulkhead, are those that they have when they think you are not there. If the problem exists, fix it; don't tell users how to discuss it. It will make the game harder to fix if your users are afraid to talk about problems.Time and time again, the CEO of Bulkhead will insist that hacking reports and bugs should be reported via e-mail instead of posted on reddit. Perhaps it is a more useful way to message the developers, but any good developer understands that they are serving the consumer and not the other way around. Posting problems on reddit is the new normal. We use reddit because the public nature allows significant issues to get a lot more visible traction that developers can then clearly see the impact of. If a lot of people comment on one issue versus another, they know where their priorities should be. If you don't like that, tough. If you're afraid of bad press, then fix the game instead of telling users to keep the problems to channels where they can't be picked up on by potential buyers or journalists. At this point, even if the game somehow makes a miraculous comeback and becomes legitimately popular, I will still struggle to support a developer like Bulkhead. It is clear that they are very actively concerned with message control surrounding Battalion 1944's very glaring issues. Instead of putting their heads down and working on them, however, they continue to tell their userbase how to behave to put up a front of success even as the CCU dwindles. Their flippant, frequent stubbornness is anti-consumer and has no place in video games. I regret my purchase.

Monster Hunter World is, at its core, a game of fast paced action, battling huge boss Monsters, where Tactics and well timed Combos really matter. Genre: Action RPG |  Score: +++ Highly Recommend + Pros: 4x Coop | Depth | Environment | Cats! 
- Cons: Grind | Progress Walls | Story Coop
 ¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†·êÅ ·êÅ ·êÅ full review below ·êÅ ·êÅ ·êÅMonster Hunter World has been around for a while now on PC (and even longer on consoles) but with a new incoming expansion (Iceborne) and the price dropping I thought a review might help some people decide if the game was for them.The player take the role of a hunter recruited by the 5th fleet, and aided by a handler and a trusty Palico assistant (basically a little cat helper). You are tasked by The Research Commission to travel to the New World to study the activities of  Elder Dragons (tremendously powerful monsters on a truly massive scale). Character customisation is good with lots of options and you can even customise your Palico.The game may appear a little complex at first but once you have played for a while the basics will become very familiar. The formula is essentially this:- Obtain a quest from the mission board in the Headquarters, these will typically be to either kill or capture a large monster, kill a number of smaller monsters or collect a number of items around the map.- Optionally stock up on items that will aid you on the hunt and have a meal that will boost your stats.- Gather up your party or head off solo to the area on the map the quest is set in.- Use your scout flies to find the monsters tracks and follow them until you find the monster- Batter the monster over the head (or weakspot) with your oversized weapon until they die or run away. If they run away repeat the step above.- Harvest the monster for materials which can be used back at the Forge to make better armour and weapons.Capturing monsters involves creating traps and tranquillisers, damaging a monster sufficiently (until they are limping and low health), luring the monster into the trap and then using the tranquillisers to knock it unconscious. This can be done on both capture and hunt quests.Large monsters are pretty varied and will change depending on the area of map your in - Giant lizards (Jagras), Fire breathing T-Rexs (Anjanath), Giant electric squirrels (Tobi-kadachi), Dragons (Rathian), Inflatable Albino bats (Paolumu) to list just a few you will meet at the start (there are many many more). The more you track a monster the more info you will find out about them (information becomes available in your monster field guide), each has its own set of weak spots and each has its own set of resistances and vulnerabilities. To be most effective, hunters should use appropriate equipment for the monster they are going to battle. (for example having armour that is highly resistant to fire and a weapon that deals water damage when facing the fire breathing Anjanath)Map areas are grouped by biome (Ancient Forest, Desert, a Cora landscape, etc)  and each have a very different aesthetic, plants and wildlife. Bugs an smaller creatures can be caught in your net to craft potions or items later, some can even be kept as pets in your room. Mushrooms, seeds and plants can be harvested, you can catch fish with your net or rod and bait, you can explore and find quests, new campsites and hidden areas. Each location is made up of a number of different zones seamlessly connected together and which you can travel between and explore freely. Levels have quite a lot of verticality and complexity and I often times find myself getting turned around or lost (but perhaps that's just me!) There are 14 main weapon types in the game each with their own style and abilities, each of these types then has many different variants which can be crafted using materials collected and harvested during missions. There is also huge array of different armour (for you and your Palico) which can be crafted at the forge, each has its own set of armour values, elemental resistances and bonuses, as you progress through the game and fight more monsters more of these armour sets and weapons will become available. I would recommend testing out the different weapons in the sparing area until you find one that suites your playstyle (also don't be afraid of swapping around either).I've given you some of basics but its really only scratching the surface, this game has a massive depth to it which really helps considering a few of its flaws. The Grind, you will in Monster Hunter World need to fight the same type of monsters quite a number of times before you are able to progress onto a stronger monster (especially if solo). This is to increase your hunters level and also to gather the required materials to craft new sets of armour, weapons and items you will need against stronger foes. Until you learn a monsters attack pattern you may well have a hard time avoiding attacks which can be powerful (rage attacks) with certain monsters and cause you to faint (sometimes in one hit if under geared and under powered). Due to the way this works this can sometimes create something of a progress wall (my first was the Anjanath) where you feel overpowered against the weaker monsters but get utterly trashed by the stronger ones. If you meet one of these either find a good team to support you or upgrade your equipment to best suit the fight and learn the attack pattern, you will get through eventually!Graphics are good, even better with the free HD texture pack, I would recommend using reshade (guides are available) if colours are a little washed out, that and turning off motion blur. Lip syncing in cut scenes for English is absurd but easily overlooked.Playing a mission in 4 player coop (max 16 in session, max 4 per mission) is a lot of fun, and I would recommend coop as the way to play the game, however there is an issue with coop and the story campaign. For some reason (best known to themselves) Capcom require players to first play a story mission through until the end of the cut sequences / start of the battle before other players can join them in coop. This often means to play a story mission coop you need all players to start the quest, play until the battle, abandon the quest and then restart in coop mode, its quite absurd but possible to work around. However story missions are only part of the game and arena quests, optional quests, events and investigations do not have this issue. In addition to quests you can free roam the different biomes in expedition mode, but to do this in coop you first need to complete a quest with your team and all select return to camp.Well done if you've managed to read this far, honestly there is so much more I haven't covered in this review and more still I have yet to explore in the game but I hope this review has given you a feel for the game and some of the basics. Despite a few flaws this game remains a thoroughly enjoyable experience, particularly for coop play and I would highly recommend it.Agree / Disagree with anything in this review? 
Please let me know in the comments below.

HOTLINE MIAMI - Fun, Fast, Challenging & Compelling  || 9 || Score Comment   Graphics 8 The 16-Bit style retro graphics are detailed and stylish, really adding to the overall atmosphere of the game. Everything from the characters you meet, the decor of buildings, the white 80's suits of the enemies to your car are all extremely well done and all add to the 80's Miami feel.   Audio 9 Game music and effects are outstanding, you can hear the pounding beat of the music increase  in intensity as the levels progress and the game becomes ever more frantic. Although the music is looped it isn't repetitive and I found, even after dying for the tenth time in a row, it still felt fresh and exciting helping to throw you back into the fight.  Gameplay 9 Hotline Miami is full of fast packed action, even best laid plans go astray in a moment forcing you to improvise, think on your feet and when all else fails rely on quick button pressing. As the levels progress the game becomes more challenging, but by this point your hooked and need to see the story through to the bitter end.   Story 9 Dark & suspenseful, the story is surprising deep and engaging (for what on the surface appears to be a fairly simple game). Sometimes the game will leave you wondering exactly what is happening to you, sometimes small details will change between levels (who's that person in my apartment? who is ringing my phone?...) but they all help to weave the story of the characters descent into a world of crime, murder and madness   Replayability 6 There isn't much to say here, the story is linear so it mostly depends on how much you enjoyed playing the first time round. There are lots of masks to collect which give you certain bonuses that might appeal to completionists.   Overall 9 A true gaming classic, retro 80's, ultra-violent, stylish, solid challenging game play with awesome music and a great story. lots of fun to play, highly recommended.
